number of helpful: 4 of 13 people (31%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 27, 2014
												The engine is very old and outdated, and even with Bohemia constantly updating and optimizing the game, it still runs poorly on modern computers. They stretched the engine to the very limits, but it's just too old to do much with.As for the gameplay, the engine is still holding the game back. Compared to modern gameplay (and even real military combat) it's really slowpaced and clunky to control. The shooting mechanics are pretty in-depth and fairly fun though, but you will often find yourself getting killed with little indication simply because of the failures of the engine. There is little feedback in this game; shooting someone causes no movement or any kind of indication of pain or disability, so it's incredibly hard to tell if you are hitting and doing any real damage some times until they fall down with the prone animation or the death animation. You almost immediately notice just how many work-arounds they had to implement to get the engine to do what they want, sort of like how Blizzard had to work around their old engine for WoW.As for the simulation side of things: it's probably the best you'll ever get to a fun simulation of combat without playing those really cheesey and un-fun military simulators out there. The game can be as realistic as you want, since you have to set the rules for yourself. Want military-grade training and cooperation with a heavy dose of roleplay? You might be interested in ShackTac. Want to just mess around and have fun without much serious RP? There are tons of those, but I recommend getting friends to play with for this.Over all, the game is really showing its age even though it isn't that old. The technology wasn't ready for a game of this scale when it was released, and it shows, not to mention the really bad engine.But despite these things, I think it's safe to say that this game is the most fun you can have in a cooperative video game. There is nothing like playing ACE with 3-7 friends on missions meant for 20-30 people. There is nothing like assaulting militia bases in Takistan with 3 of your best mates, going up against the odds well into the morning. There is no feeling similar to what you can get when you organize your close friends to all install ACE mod and playing it for the first time, helping eachother out of the ropes.I can't recommend this game to anyone anymore, as ARMA III is now here and there is no reason to play this game anymore since the mods have all been updated for the new game. But rest assured: this game will always have a place deep in my heart.I only have a few hours played here because there's no reason to launch ARMA II over Operation Arrowhead.

number of helpful: 4 of 13 people (31%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 4, 2014
												If the CallofDuty & BattleField series leave you hungry for something much more realistic, try ARMA. However, it does have many flaws, including an overly complex difficult interface, advanced but very inconsistent and cheating AI, and a lot of serious bugs. The singleplayer is somewhat broken (if only they would do it like in the original Operation Flashpoint). Multiplayer was once the main appeal, but now few people play online, and it was always very vulnerable to hacking. But there is still nothing quite like ARMA. Graphics are excellent, but you need a very powerful PC for smooth gameplay.

number of helpful: 57 of 124 people (46%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 30, 2013
												This review is all done after initially playing about 5 hours of said game.I don't believe I have ever had a more confusing experience. I really wanted to like this game. It's extremely ambitious in design and looks pretty solid in areas. Modes such as Armory are relatively fun and grand in scope; however, playing the game is a frustrating experience. The controls are very strange and do not come to the player easily. You have to fiddle around with it to get it to your liking, which is easier said than done. Think about most first person shooter games with their controls: now remove aspects of sensitivity and general feeling of control on the weapon. I had a problem on more than one occassion where I died because I could not aim at the enemy at all. After going through the control menu, I selected a lock-on control scheme. The only way I could manage to hit anything is with this mode, and I'm questioning if I am simply stupid or the game is too buggy. Another problem I have is picking up weapons; it's very slow, and causes certain games (DayZ) to be incredulously hard to play because you end up getting caught off guard trying to get a weapon that you can't aim anyway. There are multiple views (third and first), and first person view is relatively hard on the eyes as the head bob on it is ridiculous (you can set it lower); I find myself more comfortable with the third person view, which gives a bigger picture anyway.The worst thing I encountered in ArmA II (or any of its other games) is that it simply isn't fun. I never felt like anything was going to plan, that almost everything I did was hindered by the control. Perhaps if I had a controller, the game would respond better. Another big deal is the bugs within the game; they constantly appear, from minor ones as texture problems to really big bugs such as your helicopter flipping over randomly to kill you, lock the screen, and cause you to bring up task manager to get out of the game.The frustration does not end there for me. I also wanted to get in on the DayZ Mod, which conveniently has a download on Steam. This download is not an updated version however, and is completely and utterly incompatible with 99% of online DayZ servers. So, you have to download a completely separate mod, DayZ Commander, to update all of your ArmA II games/DLC and also download updates to the DayZ mod, and then you can finally play a game. Great, right?Wrong. Most servers seem to require something called "DayZ Epoch", another mod of a mod that you need to download. An extra 400mb on.So you get that done, and you're ready. It's too bad that the mod has the exact same flaws as ArmA II that I listed above. I struggle to hit ANYTHING, and if I don't have a weapon, finding one while zombies attack you is next to impossible. The atmosphere is pretty cool, and the immersiveness is great, but it just doesn't seem to work at all for me. I do note here that the creators of ArmA II did not create the DayZ mod, but I have it here for reference due to the fact a great deal of players buy this game to play this mod.In conclusion, I do not recommend this game; I dislike it for many reasons. If you feel like you can deal with a lot of frustration and can look past multiple issues within a game, then this is for you. I wanted to love this, as it offers a lot, but my experience with it has been bad and I wish it wasn't.Wait until your friend gifts you this, or try it out before you spend your money. Don't regret buying a game you cannot refund.Graphics: 8/10 "Graphics are sound. Texture issues are common for me. Other than that, it is very good."Gameplay: 4/10 "Lack of real control in weapons and in vehicles. Helicopters sometimes bug out and flip completely over, and one time caused my game to completely lock up for no apparent reason."Overall Fun: 3/10 "I tried desperately to have some semblance of fun in this game, but I barely got that. Armory mode is the most fun I had with this game, and it barely delivers."Total Average: 5/10My apologies to the developers, but this simply was not my cup of tea. If it were not for the hard to handle control scheme this would be much higher. Perhaps it's me that is stupid, but I don't believe so.EDIT 18/1/2014: I got a controller and attempted to play it to give it another chance, hoping something would be different. It was actually worse. Sensitivity and control is so bad, I literally either miss the target, accidentally hit one, or (and most of the time) get killed before I can manage to aim at a target. Don't even say  that "you're not giving it enough time" because I'm just so tired of the crap controls, annoyed at the constant bugs, frustrated with the lack of instruction, and I am just generally regretting this purchase. Consider this game a 4/10.

number of helpful: 13 of 32 people (41%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 16, 2014
												Building on 10 years of constant engine development, ARMA II boasts the most realistic combat environment in the world. It models real world ballistics & round deflection, materials penetration, features a realtime day/night cycle and dynamic wind, weather and environmental effects. The simulation of a combat environment is so effective, the engine forms the basis for training simulators used by real armies the world over. Although ARMA II is set in the fictional ex-soviet state of 'Chernarus' the gameworld is actually a 225 square kilometer chunk of the real world! ARMA II's highly detailed landscape is a meticulous facsimile of real terrain, modeled using extensive geographical data. This recreated region is brought to life with spectacular environmental effects and populated with dynamic civilian settlements and wildlife. Wild animals roam the atmospheric forests while the people of Chernarus try to live out their lives among the war-torn streets. The 27th U.S. Marine Expeditionary Unit have been deployed to the former soviet country of Chernarus in this third installment in the series of award winning PC war simulators from Bohemia Interactive, creators of Operation Flashpoint*: Cold War Crisis and ARMA: Combat Operations. Force Reconnaissance Team Razor are among the first to fight. This elite five-man team are about to fall down the rabbit hole, trapped in a war not only for control of the country, but the hearts and minds of its people. With the might of the USMC offshore and the Russians anxiously watching from the north, the stakes couldn't be higher. The fate of Chernarus is balanced on a razor's edge...

number of helpful: 0 of 5 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 29, 2015
												    Arma 2 is routinely billed as a hardcore military simulation, something it rountinely does not live up to. I grew up playing hardcore military titles, encouraged by my father, who served in the US Army Rangers and he asked I show him this game when I first got it. Over the years I had shown him a few other military sims, ultimately ending in America's Army, which he said was pretty good for what it was but still had problems. So when I sat down to play this in the living room on the big tv, wireless keyboard and mouse on the coffee table, I was apprehensive. I already had problems with this game, namely that there is an emphasis on accurate mid to long range shooting, but no way to actually range find something unless I wanted to do trigonometry on a notebook next to me. Mildy apprehensive, I boot up the PC and start the game, loading the first actual mission of the singleplayer campaign, and going through it for his input, which leads to my second point. My second issue was actually in the sound design of the game, something he pointed out to me. Gunshots sound like the pops of an airgun if they're aimed at you, which many are, and like snaps if they're going away from you. Certain weapons have different sounds, like the M107 sniper rifle or the various handguns. But the biggest weapon sound failure was actually in the Kalashnikov pattern weapons, in that they all sound identical. Yes, the AKS-74U  has the same sound as the KSVK, despite firing a smaller, lighter projectile at a slower speed. We keep going through the campaign, eventually culminating in the retaking of a small city from enemy forces, when he stopped me. He said to me that while the game certainly does excellent in bullet drop and the "cool" features, it falls flat on many others that he had seen, especially during the city capture mission, where a grand total of maybe twenty marines is tasked with clearing a city. Marines are many things, but retaking a small city with that few soldiers is not how any modern military deploys.     So he asked to see what else the game offers, and I take him back to the menus to load up the armory, where I could play around with the various weapons and vehicles and whatnot to see how they work. To save time, because neither of us were terribly patient at this point, I went into my save file and made the armory fully unlocked to play around in. I showed him a handful of weapons and completed little challenges with each one. His and my most vocal disapproval came with the various expectations of accurate shooting at long range with abolutely no way to properly determine range from target. We noticed this during an assassination mission using an M24 rifle, where I had found a nice little ridgeline about 250 meters from my target. I look down the sight and realize something: every military sim had different mil dot measurements. Operation Flashpoint Dragon Rising, which I had played a week prior, used 100 meter measurements. So I turn to him and ask what the normal mil dot measurement on the M24 was, to which he countered that it varied based on magnificiation and asked how magnified the scope was. I shrug and fire off a test shot with the targets mushy face under the second dot down, which resulted in a clear miss, hitting ground some unknowable distance away, not that anyone noticed. So I lower a bit so the first dot is over his face and fired again, this time hitting him in the upper torso. I said that the scope is in 200 meter measurements, having shot the guy who murders kittens or something deserving like that,     Mission done, I return to the armory and get a russian IFV thing and start driving. Going down a hill I switch to third person to see what I'm doing, having kicked the driver out to drive myself. Upon reaching flat land, first person view is switched to and I start laughing. In their hurry to make the game realistic, the devs made the vehicle I was driving have this periscope thing that I could not interact with in front of the drivers face. I switch to gunner and commander, same issue. So I ask my dad to go on google and look up the vehicle I was driving, which actually had periscopes and whatnot for the crew to see through. Impressed and annoyed, I go back one last time to the armory and choose a helicopter to drive. Now, I don't have a flightstick, but I'm fair at flight sims with mouse and keyboard. The map loads and I'm in mid air, already flying. No take off from a carrier or airfield, but spawned in mid air. I shrug and go with it, him watching from over my shoulder. I look on the map for an airfield to try and land at, spending a good few minutes staring at the landscape on my way there. I switch to third person view for the landing, as is my habit, and brush the branches of a tree during my descent, which naturally made the helicopter explode and stop moving, falling straight to the ground while a sad little song started. It was about this time that I quit the game and started powering down, having lost patience for Arma 2 at around the same time my dad did.     In short, Arma 2 is playable but doesn't feel finished in a lot of different ways.

content:
Posted: December 2, 2013
												Ehhh...not impressed.  I bought this game on sale (thankfully!) but I barely got past the tutorial.  Why?  Well, where do I begin?  Let's start with these few complaints: 1) the objective markers on screen are not only very faint, but they are almost the same color as the background.  So it's REALLY hard to see where you are supposed to be headed.2) not only are the controls not very intuitive, but...3) the controls are also totally OVER-WHELMING (so many damn commands there aren't enough buttons on the keyboard...literally!  Commands need to be double-keyed -- for example: tap x to perform this action, double-tap x to perform this action, press and hold x to perform this action, etc, etc.)  It's ridiculous.4) graphics are mediocre; not terrible, but not definitely great either.I could list more complaints, but that would probably qualify this review as "a rant", so I'll spare you.  In any case, for this game I'll say: Don't waste your money.  Just my two cents...

content:
Posted: May 8, 2011
												If your in the neighborhood for a good F.P.S and your thinking "well geeze I enjoyed Modern Warfare and Battlefield series so I'm sure Arma is right up my alley" think again. THIS GAME IS NOT LIKE THAT AT ALL!  It is very much a simulator and a very frustrating one for those (like me) who have never played a war sim before. I'm sure this would have been a great game if I had gone into it with the right mindset, but as it is this game just frustrates the hell out of me. If you like infuriating controls , endeless inventory and control screens and the worst voice acting in the history of games, than this thing is for you!Totally impressed by the scope of the maps (bordering on M.M.O style of map size)and the game physics are awesome....but it just didn't do it for me.Great community though.

number of helpful: 5 of 17 people (29%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 1, 2014
												Lets see here.Controls are about as intuitive as holding a really slippery bar of soap with your elbows in that you have to go through ten menus to pick up a gun or get in a tank. Character moves like he's got concrete for feet. Aiming does nothing. NPC enemies are psychic. Did i mention the ♥♥♥♥ing menus? And you have to do that under fire. And then slog ten miles. The UI literally tells you nothing about where to go. I like freedom in games. But no direction at all is worse than extreme linearity.Graphics look like something from 2000 even on highest settings. Characters phase through doors. People have no emotion. The facial animation can be out done by a sock puppet. Characters also have these horrfying souless eyes. Sound is just...bland.Back to the combat. Even on easy your character can barely take a wad of spit before the bones in his legs suddenly turn into powder. And good ♥♥♥♥ing luck getting an NPC medic to help, since he's off picking his nose with the barrel of his gun.So no. Don't even bother. Call of Duty is at least entertaining for ten minutes. This just isn't entertaining at all. Its confusing and frustrating.

content:
Posted: April 26, 2016
												Arma II is a commendable game on many levels.  It is open, it tries to be realistic, and in many ways it succeeds.  There are plausible scenarios, tons of weapons, interesting views and tactics.  But.  The UI is clunky, the controls are clunky the feel of the game itself is clunky and needlessly complex.  On top of these points, the dialogue and music are hardly compelling, in fact, they are like cheese on a soggy pizza.  Yes, it's technically pizza, and pizza is good, but this is some bad cheese.  The best part about Arma II is that you can mod Arma II.  You can add extra toppings to make the whole thing a little more palatable.  Can I recommend Arma II as a buy that is used to create a fun gaming experience?  Absolutely.  Can I recommend it as a stand-alone product?  Unlikely.  This review reflects Arma II as a standalone game, and as a standalone piece of software it gets a 6.8/10.  Mediocre at best despite its grand aspirations.

number of helpful: 3 of 24 people (13%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 23, 2014
												Arma 2 review..... Kinda. After playing 114 minutes of Arma2 I realize now why I got it for $4 on a Steam sale. It's so amazingly clunky and buggy it's almost impossible to hit anything. Felt like I was playing an alpha version. Not to mention the controls are so weird I don't even know where to begin. One of the few impressive things about this game is map and terrain size, as the game environments are massive. But besides that, the dialogue and interface for issuing commands to my team were barely functional since my team acts like drunken, glitched out morons that often caused me to fail objectives. The graphics are total crap on default settings, and I was only able to play on maxed settings to see anything more than 3 feet infront of me. By default everything is like looking through someone else's glasses that make everything super blurry. I had to max everything out to see the textures clearly without any blurring. But what I saw looked more like they were intentionally blurry, and there's no way that can seriously be the way the game is intended to be played. Maybe there are other great things about this game, but I'm not willing to go that far yet since I have many more games to play on my list. Perhaps I'll revisit this game at a later date. But for now, I'm not going to wander into megaglitchland again for a while. Sorry for the negative review. Arma II: 2.

content:
Posted: November 13, 2016
												What a terrible game. I want to like it and I really want to play it.But the interface is one of the worst I have ever seen in my 20+ years of gaming.The input lag on the mouse is one of the first things that caused me to never want to "get into" the game. It makes it so hard to play. My system can run this 7+ year old game on max, but the gfx are terrible, even for their time. I understand they needed more rendered at a time for the larger viewing distances. But they skimped a little too much. And this is no excuses for the local "close to the player" textures being so low detail and low general quality.The indisputable, non-industry standard control scheme makes the game unplayable. The hints that show up the first time you run through the game are too hard to notice and disappear before you had a chance to read them, or test that control. The creators choosing not to use the space bar for jump is not okay. The constant excuse of "This is a simulation, its too realistic for you! If its too hard, go back to CoD. N00b!" "Their control scheme is part of what sets the game apart." Is right along the same lines as Apple removing the headphone jack from their phones, and all the USB A ports and MagSafe port from their MAC Book Pro. Its not edgy or progressive, its just very annoying and difficult to deal with. It seems that the ARMA II community is less willing to hear about and suggest any fixes for the games problems, and more willing to FLAME the thousands who have mentioned these issues. I have read the excuse "This is a simulation, not a game.", touted by every fan boy, hundreds  of times now. This excuse is used the majority time they need to defend the game against a genuine problem or technical issues that, honestly, shouldn't have been there. Well let me help you out a bit. Are you PLAYING this on your PC, is there no physical effort or risk to yourself? And do you actually learn real tactics, logistics, firearms operation, actual military radio communication rules, tactical or group vehicle operation, etc.? No? I hate to break it to these fan boys, but: THIS IS NOT A SIMULATION. IT IS A PC GAME! If you want to claim you were in a military or similar simulation, you need to get off your corpulent, arm-chair commando, un-educated (in such matters) posteriors and actually: Join the Military, Participate in some of their publically accessible education programs, Take some actual training somewhere, Etc. Or you could just stop pretending that this game is a simulation and that it "taught" you anything at all, other than how to play another PC game. A terribly made game at that.The controls are not intuitive at all. If this were meant to actually be a simulation then I could easily switch my weapons fire mode with no thought. At the bare minimum, a simulation should be teaching you how to do this. (Like I can in real life. No thought. If I need to change the fire mode on my AR, I just move my right thumb to flip the selector on the left side of my rifle). But the game doesn't actually teach you anything real. So stop claiming that this is a "Super realistic military simulation". It's not.This review was sparked by a completely terrible experience when attempting to play this game. There are a LOT more issues I didn't cover here because there are too many for me to address. Just Google it, you will quickly get your fill. I would NEVER recommend this game to anyone else. At least not with out a full briefing on the quality and status.

number of helpful: 7 of 42 people (17%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: November 16, 2016
												I bought this game and the Operation Arrowhead expansion just to play DayZ. Yet I decided to give the game a try since I owned it.It was probably one of the worst campaigns I've ever played.My friend and I wanted to do co-op and play through it. It was one of the most buggy games ever. There were times where a cutscene was happening and it would just freeze or kick him out of the game. The AI was even worse. Sometimes they'd stand there and shoot at you for 30 seconds and not hit you, or kill you within 3 seconds. The voice acting was so bad. It made us both laugh anytime anyone said anything. It was that terrible. It did have some cool elements. Like after a few missions, being able to travel the entire map searching for something. Using whatever vehicle and even calling in a helicopter to give rides. When the AI helicopter pilot worked that is. It often landed on a roof or would just hover there staring at you.Overall, this game doesn't look pretty, isn't optimized, is buggy and doesn't offer too much in terms of solid gameplay.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 15, 2014
												To start off, this game is not easy for new comers. This game is no cod or battlefield. At first you are going to be so confused and be walking around the map like a huge confused noob. But the helpful community will definetly help you out with anything.  I had someone tell me all the basics of the game for about an hour! 2 days later after playing for a little bit I enjoyed the game soooo much and new alot about it. If you go on youtube there will be many tutorials about the game. They also helped. Then, the graphics. The graphics for the game are decent and can run good on alot of computers. For a game in 2009 the graphics are 8.9. Next, the gameplay is great. It is really fun if you roleplay with it. What I mean is when I was with my clan we were playing coop and it was funiest thing ever. For example, this was how we were talking "Bravo! We need air support!" Finnally, this is about the realism. The realism in this game is crazy. Everything is exactly like real life. (It is a millitary simulator)THIS GAME IS RATED 9.2! GREAT GAME! (WON MANY AWARDS)

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 15, 2014
												90% of people who buy Arma 2 buy it to play DayZ and never actually get into the core game. Honestly, it is awesome. While I personally don't enjoy the campaign and pre-made missions, I absolutely love the mission editor. It is the coolest thing; it basically gives you the ability to construct small battles all-the-way-to large wars. I have played it for hours, creating missions and stories to my liking. If want a game that is largely customizable, I highly recommend Arma 2... also, DayZ is pretty awesome (standalone is out, get it if you haven't).

												           This game is perferct for realism, tactical strategy, and overall teamwork. What I mean with realism isn't the graphics, it's the fact that it is a military simulation. number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 14, 2013
												Oh ho ho this game makes me smile whenever I hear about it. Its an AWESOME game (despite some flaws with player controls) nonetheless in the long run. The Arma 2 campaign isnt too amazing, but thats just because it's a open world military simulator trying to tell a linear story. The editor and the multiplayer is where this game really becomes badass, the editor is really a game editor and once you learn some basic scripts for it, then you can litterally become god with it. The multiplayer lets you release your awesome missions into the world, but you have to play it to get what I mean! BUY IT! SOOOOOOOOOOO MANY PERKS!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 29, 2011
												Highly recommended for Coop! Has everything you want as far as military hardware and if not, its probably in the works to come out or i in a mod.However a little rough around the edges. Fit and finish is a little bit off compared to alot of other games, but I can guarantee after playing it for a couple hours you will see how easily it is to get immersed. First hour of playing will be taken up with getting aquainted with controls and functions in game, but after you learn the basics (takes 15-20min) you can get into some action.ArmA 3 mechanics and physics should be better with Physix implementation in the engine which it badly needs I'll admit. You notice the clunky nature mostly as infantry and its more reminiscent of Ghost Recon in that respect. Visuals are awesome. Effects could use some work in some minor respects but overall things look great! Textures and models of vehicles are what make this game I'll admit not to mention the unparalleled Coop and mod-ability.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 15, 2014
												Without a doubt this is the best war simulator money can buy. I didnt get too involved with the story mode, because the real fun to be had is with multiplayer. Servers like Evolution Blue/Red really bring the best out of the game. Showing you how you can use teamwork and different classes and tactics to take down your opponent. This is nothing like COD because with this you cant just run behind enemy lines and get a bunch of kills and respawn half way across the tiny map and just run back. With Arma you need a plan and teamwork. You cant just send in a bunch of bombers to destroy the target, you need to take out the AA's who threaten the air support first then you have to let the ground infantry do it's job and take out any main targets you need to complete the mission then you can bomb the area but first you have to get the troops out. This isn't very easy and the hardest part is working together with others to do this. But if done right Arma will get you very involved and will make you feel like your on the front lines and it's all or nothing. Overall if you want a good War Simulator this is the game to buy.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 22, 2012
												Realistic war game simulation, enough said. If you are shot, you WILL die. If you are being healed it WILL take forever. If you shoot a gun it WILL make a sound. Games like Battlefield or Call of Duty simply can't compare to this game when it comes to realism. Sadly, if your the type of person that likes a fast paced game, then Arma II, and REAL LIFE, are not going to be your cup of tea. Look elsewere. However, Slight bonus. If you buy Combined Operations, you get access to a free Mod known as DayZ. This is a Realistic zombie survival simulation. Its very fun and adrenaline pumping at times, even more so with friends or Team Speak. However, patience is a virtue NEEDED in this game. You WILL die. You WILL lose all your gear. You WILL be robbed by other players and killed. And you WILL break your legs, Bleed out, run out of ammo, etc. etc. etc. Hope you enjoy. :D

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 16, 2014
												Well, let me begin with THIS GAME IS NOT LIKE CALL OF DUTY! This is a tactical realistic shooter. This is meant for people who love intense battles with tactical thinking and strategy in it. This game's editor is KING, I mean by you can create epicness with it. You wanna recreate a realistic battle? Yes. You wanna do a night time raid on an airfield guarded by tanks which you can rig with C4? Yes. You can do ANYTHING which is totally awesome. Those of you who love Battlefield and Call of Duty, cool, but if your looking to this game, well you should not. This game is meant for hardcore FPS who love every type of shooters not a run-and-gun type game. This game has awesome multiplayer too. I love Chernarus Life and Wasteland. Those are fun modes like Day Z without zombies. Speaking of Day Z, that mod has faded since the Standalone's release but I will tell you, most of the servers are all out PVP. So, for those of you guys who like and aim towards hardcore and unforgiving choices, go get this game now, or else...

												I personally regard this game as the best military simulator i've ever seen or played and, as such, I highly recommend Arma 2 to any gamer who appreciates a highly detailed and fun military shooter/sim.On the other side though, most highly populated multiplayer servers're plagued by hackers/scripters which cause all sorts of problems during game including completely crumbling any sense of immersion which existed before their arrival into your game. because of this, my score for the game is dropped by two points due to the lack of an effective way of preventing those hackers/scripter from doing their thing.(8/10) 8 out of 10)

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 19, 2012
												The all-time best military simulator on the market. Nothing can compare to Arma's realistic uses of military gear and gadgets.With it's community additions, Arma has become a host for multiple types of game modes based around the principle of life and combat. Free-to-Play has opened up the game to many players, while DayZ has reinvigorated the interest in the game.The only downside to the game is the addition of Free-to-Play. More players are open to play Arma 2, which means more hackers are able to play. Along with the fact that you can make as many accounts as you want, hackers are basically rampant everywhere.Otherwise, it's a great play if you like Shooters as well as some realism. If you come from Call of Duty, get out of here!I would also suggest buying Combined Operations in order to open up all modification and play possibilities.

Posted: March 11, 2014
												The United States Army (USA) is the main branch of the United States Armed Forces responsible for land-based military operations. It is the largest and oldest established branch of the U.S. military, and is one of seven U.S. uniformed services. The modern army has its roots in the Continental Army which was formed on 14 June 1775, to meet the demands of the American Revolutionary War before the establishment of the United States. The Congress of the Confederation officially created the United States Army on 3 June 1784 after the end of the Revolutionary War to replace the disbanded Continental Army. The army considers itself to be descended from the Continental Army and thus dates its inception from the origins of that force.The primary mission of the army is "to fight and win our Nation’s wars by providing prompt, sustained land dominance across the full range of military operations and spectrum of conflict in support of combatant commanders."The army is a military service within the Department of the Army, one of the three military departments of the Department of Defense. The army is headed by the Secretary of the Army, and the top military officer in the department is the Chief of Staff of the Army. The highest ranking army officer is currently the Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff. During fiscal year 2011, the Regular Army reported a strength of 546,057 soldiers; the Army National Guard (ARNG) reported 358,078 and the United States Army Reserve (USAR) reported 201,166 putting the combined component strength total at 1,105,301 soldiers.The Continental Army was created on 14 June 1775 by the Continental Congress as a unified army for the colonies to fight Great Britain, with George Washington appointed as its commander.[4] The army was initially led by men who had served in the British Army or colonial militias and who brought much of British military heritage with them. As the Revolutionary War progressed, French aid, resources, and military thinking influenced the new army. A number of European soldiers came on their own to help, such as Friedrich Wilhelm von Steuben, who taught the army Prussian tactics and organizational skills.The army fought numerous pitched battles and in the South 1780–81 sometimes used the Fabian strategy and hit-and-run tactics, hitting where the enemy was weakest, to wear down the British forces. Washington led victories against the British at Trenton and Princeton, but lost a series of battles around New York City in 1776 and Philadelphia in 1777. With a decisive victory at Yorktown, and the help of the French, the Continental Army prevailed against the British.After the war, though, the Continental Army was quickly given land certificates and disbanded in a reflection of the republican distrust of standing armies. State militias became the new nation's sole ground army, with the exception of a regiment to guard the Western Frontier and one battery of artillery guarding West Point's arsenal. However, because of continuing conflict with Native Americans, it was soon realized that it was necessary to field a trained standing army. The Regular Army was at first very small, and after General St. Clair's defeat at the Battle of the Wabash, the Regular Army was reorganized as the Legion of the United States, which was established in 1791 and renamed the "United States Army" in 1796.General Andrew Jackson stands on the parapet of his makeshift defenses as his troops repulse attacking Highlanders during the defense of New Orleans, the final major battle of the War of 1812The War of 1812, the second and last American war against Britain, was less successful than the Revolution had been. Despite the Burning of York and Death of Tecumseh which caused his Indian confederacy to collapse, an invasion of Canada failed, and U.S. troops were unable to stop the British from burning the new capital of Washington, D.C.. However, the Regular Army, under Generals Alexander Macomb and Samuel Smith, proved they were professional and capable of defeating the British army during the invasions of Plattsburgh and Baltimore, and the relatively small US Navy, often attached with Marines, earned most of the victory against the Royal Navy at sea. Two weeks after a treaty was signed, Andrew Jackson defeated the British in the Battle of New Orleans and became a national hero. Per the treaty both sides returned to the status quo with no victor.The army's major campaign against the Indians was fought in Florida against Seminoles. It took long wars (1818–1858) to finally defeat the Seminoles and move them to Oklahoma. The usual strategy in Indian wars was to seize control of the Indians winter food supply, but that was no use in Florida where there was no winter. The second strategy was to form alliances with other Indian tribes, but that too is no use because the Seminoles had destroyed all the other Indians when they entered Florida in the late eighteenth century.The U.S. Army fought and won the Mexican–American War (1846–1848), which was a defining event for both countries. The U.S. victory resulted in acquisition of territory that eventually became all or parts of the states of California, Nevada, Utah, Colorado, Arizona, Wyoming and New Mexico.The Civil War was the most costly war for the U.S. in terms of casualties. After most states in the South seceded to form the Confederate States of America, CSA troops opened fire on the Union-held Fort Sumter in Charleston, South Carolina, starting the war. Forces loyal to the United States were commonly called the Union Army during that war.For the first two years Confederate forces solidly defeated the U.S. Army, with a few exceptions.[ The Confederates had the advantage of defending a very large country in an area where disease caused twice as many deaths as combat. The Union pursued a strategy of seizing the coastline, blockading the ports, and taking control of the river systems. By 1863 the Confederacy was being strangled. Its eastern armies did very well in combat, but the western armies were defeated one after another until New Orleans was lost in 1862 along with the Tennessee River, the Mississippi River was lost in 1863, and Atlanta fell in 1864.[13] Grant took command of Union forces in 1864 and after a series of battles with very heavy casualties, he had Lee under siege in Richmond. Lee lost his Confederate capital in April 1865 and was captured at Appomatox Courthouse; the other Confederate armies quickly surrendered.The war remains the deadliest conflict in American history, resulting in the deaths of 620,000 soldiers. Based on 1860 census figures, 8% of all white males aged 13 to 43 died in the war, including 6% in the North and 18% in the South.Following the Civil War, the U.S. Army fought a long battle with several western tribes of Native AmericansBy the 1890s the U.S. saw itself as a potential international player. U.S. victories in the Spanish–American War and the controversial and less well known Philippine–American War, as well as U.S. intervention in Latin America and the Boxer Rebellion, gained America more land and power.Starting in 1910, the army began acquiring fixed-wing aircraft.[15] In 1910, Mexico was having a civil war, peasant rebels fighting government soldiers. The army was deployed to American towns near the border to ensure safety to lives and property. In 1916, Pancho Villa, a major rebel leader, attacked Columbus, New Mexico, prompting a U.S. intervention in Mexico until 7 February 1917. They fought the rebels and the Mexican federal troops until 1918. The United States joined World War I in 1917 on the side of Britain, France, Russia, Italy and other allies. U.S. troops were sent to the front and were involved in the push that finally broke through the German lines. Have fun killing for the land of murica

												This game is brillant. With mods. I am just reviewing Arma 2 not the expansions or Day Z. Only Arma 2 and mods for Arma 2. The games campain is trickey. You have to play multiplayer for you to get used to it then come back. You do need a really good computer to run it on the highest of high. But I have a crapy computer and I can run it on lowest of low with 50 fps. I mainly play two mods, 28 Days Later (Zombies) and Chernaus Life. These two are excellent mods. It has mic support so you can talk directly and you can pilot helis and planes. The map is MASSIVE and takes about 1-2 hours to run across and 2-3 hours going North to South. When you have a server with over 200 people it is an awesome game with friends. If you do not play with friends you will not have as much of a great time with this. Massive servers are hard to find though.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 6, 2015
												This game is awesome, **** this stupid battlefield and COD Rambo bull****, you try that in this game and you will find that you have to run for an hour just to get across the map, or you could use one of the 40 some vehicles which can be bought with funds acquired from killing the enemy. The flight and driving system is somewhat unconventional but complex and realistic. the ballistics in this game account for wind, elevation, and I believe direction as well. work with your friends online, or hire marines to fight with you, which by the way can be controled through the mini map or commands. overall this game is so realisitic that it gets rid of the "who can shoot faster" concept, and employs more strategy and timing. And one more thing, there is no "quick" sniping or any such game busting stupidity. snipers will purchase their firearm and vehicle to drive for 15 minutes, walk for another 5, scouting for 30, and shooting for 2, before they run back to an evac. this game is not about kill count, but rather strategy.99/10 would drive for another hour.

												To start off, this game is not easy for new comers. This game is no cod or battlefield. At first you are going to be so confused and be walking around the map like a huge confused noob. But the helpful community will definetly help you out with anything.  I had someone tell me all the basics of the game for about an hour! 2 days later after playing for a little bit I enjoyed the game soooo much and new alot about it. If you go on youtube there will be many tutorials about the game. They also helped. Then, the graphics. The graphics for the game are decent and can run good on alot of computers. For a game in 2009 the graphics are 8.9. Next, the gameplay is great. It is really fun if you roleplay with it. What I mean is when I was with my clan we were playing coop and it was funiest thing ever. For example, this was how we were talking "Bravo! We need air support!" Finnally, this is about the realism. The realism in this game is crazy. Everything is exactly like real life. (It is a millitary simulator)THIS GAME IS RATED 9.2! GREAT GAME! (WON MANY AWARDS)

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 3, 2013
												In summation, ARMA II is a phenominal combat simulator. The gameplay is amazing. This game is not a run-and-gun, one cannot run recklessly throughout the battlefield, and expect to go anywhere (literally, you'll get gunned down) you must rely on the teamwork with your squad members, and work together to complete the objective. The map in the game is well designed, and it's large. It really takes a long time to get from your base to the objective, depending if you're taking a vehicle or not. In conclusion, if you just came from Battlefield 3 or Call of Duty, you'll have a tough time assimilating to ARMA II.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 13, 2012
												Arma II is a fantastic military simulator. There is no game out there that is quite like it, or comes even close to its realism. It is slow paced, but thats what makes it so fantastic. You can make it fast paced if you want to though, but if you want fast just go play Call of Duty. The editor adds so many possiblites and the mods are amazing! I reccomend ACE mod for even more fun. So many possibilities, so much fun! I reccomend playing it with friends and go try hard! This awesome open world fps simulator recieves a 9.5/10 from me. (Deducted points for some glitches)

content:
Posted: January 7, 2013
												Arma 2 is a war simulator, it is a s close to reral as it it gets.You cant find a more realistic game.I would not recommend this to someone who just started PC gaming.It takes a long time to get used to the controls and ways of playing.The game requires patience and tactics.Get arma 2 free before paying for the full version.In arma 2 free yuo get the same maps just lower graphic quality and less vehicles and weapons.Link to arma 2 free:http://www.arma2.com/free. In the free version you get mission editor which alows you to place units  and objectives.If your PC doesnt meet these requirments:Core 2 Duo E7400 2.80GHzAthlon 64 X2 Dual Core 6000+GeForce GTS 240Radeon HD 48502 GB 10 GBOr if its just not a gaming pc then go to settings and to graphics and set it to: very low quality.Then your fps will be higher and you will be able to play.It will take a long time to get used to the controls since there are alot but just comment if you downloaded the game so i can make a tutorial on the basic controls and how to use mission editor.It does have mods like dynamic zombie sandbox where you are surviving a zombie apocalypse.The mods aren't as good as the ones in the full version.Communication is also an essential to playing the game; at least using the chat, if you have a microphone use voice chat in game since you can respond quickly and not get shot by friendlies.The maps are HUGE so get used to spending up to 40 minutes getting to enemy teritory.You can not choose where to spawn.So if the only games you have played are COD you are going to need some time to get used to this type of game.

												It's balls hard, buggy, and obtuse. Its not for everyone, but this is probably one of my favorite shooters of all time. More simulation than an actual game, for better or worse. Spiritual successor to Operation Flashpoint (The late 90's original; NOT Dragon Rising). If buying, probably want to just buy Op Arrowhead. It's pretty much better in every way. content:
Posted: August 7, 2014
												Complicated but necessary control scheme, and rigid gameplay, caused me to push this game away but I returned with a new attitude and appreciated it more. This game does not have the polish of a full AAA title, instead having the simulation feel and learning curve. There are a lot of things that can go wrong and it will always be your fault! After learning the conrols and command system the game becomes much more leniant. The friendly AI is still dumb as a bag of bricks but you will learn to use them as pawns instead of teammates. Mostly this game is outdated as ARMA III surpasses it in most ways, the only thing left is the DAY- Z mod. I'd buy it if your filling in your military sim collection or if you want to kill people and zombies in DAY-Z. if you're looking for fun and asthetic milsim try ARMA III for that fix.

content:
Posted: December 26, 2013
												Almost perfect, precise military simulation for a great price! I highly recommend this game for players who are interested in joining the military, or just plain want to have some fun shooting guys with strategy for a change. But be warned; the campaign is a huge challenge even on easy mode, as the map is free roam and there is only one objective. I have not yet completed the campaign, but this game has an extremely extensive editor that can create hours of fun for any gaming level.

It's controls are clunky and frustrating at first, but if you give it time and learn the controls (they are mappable, I'd be furious if they weren't.) it is a fantastic Military Sim. There are way more mods and game modes other than just DayZ, too. MSO, Island Life, etc. are all excellent game modes to try, too. The graphics are a little dated, but it's a few years old now. If Graphics are your thing, ARMA 3 is the obvious alternative. 10/10.

												If you want an FPS where you can do all your nice trickshots and play the game fast and call of duty style then i would reccommend that you stay as far as ♥♥♥♥ing possible away from arma 2. in my oppinion this isn't a bad thing, in fact i think it is an AMAZING thing because i am absolutely sick of hearing screaming 3 year olds from call of duty whining and calling people noobsnow then, on to the game itself, I admit Arma 2 is a bit rough around the edges, plenty of glitches and not so high quality physics but overall I LOVE this game,the countless number of scenarios you can find on multiplayer ( my personal favorite being Chernarus life ) is amazing, you can go from flying in with your assault team to liberate a town from the Pro-russian forces in chernarus, to being a cop patroling the city of chernogorsk. The variety of weapons is amazing, most of which are about as satisfing to fire as it can be in a video game. Overall this game is amazing, although a little bit rough around the edges I would highly reccomend it9/10 stars

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 17, 2014
												This game is brillant. With mods. I am just reviewing Arma 2 not the expansions or Day Z. Only Arma 2 and mods for Arma 2. The games campain is trickey. You have to play multiplayer for you to get used to it then come back. You do need a really good computer to run it on the highest of high. But I have a crapy computer and I can run it on lowest of low with 50 fps. I mainly play two mods, 28 Days Later (Zombies) and Chernaus Life. These two are excellent mods. It has mic support so you can talk directly and you can pilot helis and planes. The map is MASSIVE and takes about 1-2 hours to run across and 2-3 hours going North to South. When you have a server with over 200 people it is an awesome game with friends. If you do not play with friends you will not have as much of a great time with this. Massive servers are hard to find though.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 15, 2014
												To start off, this game is not easy for new comers. This game is no cod or battlefield. At first you are going to be so confused and be walking around the map like a huge confused noob. But the helpful community will definetly help you out with anything.  I had someone tell me all the basics of the game for about an hour! 2 days later after playing for a little bit I enjoyed the game soooo much and new alot about it. If you go on youtube there will be many tutorials about the game. They also helped. Then, the graphics. The graphics for the game are decent and can run good on alot of computers. For a game in 2009 the graphics are 8.9. Next, the gameplay is great. It is really fun if you roleplay with it. What I mean is when I was with my clan we were playing coop and it was funiest thing ever. For example, this was how we were talking "Bravo! We need air support!" Finnally, this is about the realism. The realism in this game is crazy. Everything is exactly like real life. (It is a millitary simulator)THIS GAME IS RATED 9.2! GREAT GAME! (WON MANY AWARDS)
